xxl.core.math.numerics.integration
Class SimpsonsRuleRealFunctionArea

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.RealFunctionArea
      xxl.core.math.numerics.integration.SimpsonsRuleRealFunctionArea

public class SimpsonsRuleRealFunctionArea
extends RealFunctionArea

This class provides the numerical integration of a real-valued function that is defined over an interval [a,b]. For the integration the Simpson's Rule is applied. The Simpson's Rule belongs to the Newton-Cotes-Formulas and bases on three weights, providing an approximation of order 4. By partitioning the interval, the Simpson's Rule can be applied iteratively. Thereby, n, the number of intervals, has to be even.

See Also:
RealFunction, RealFunctionArea, TrapezoidalRuleRealFunctionArea

simpson

public static double simpson(double a,
                             double b,
                             Function real1DFunction,
                             int n)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
Computes the area under a real-valued function for a given interval [a,b] using the Simpson's rule for numerical integration iteratively. Thereby, the number of steps has to be even.

Parameters:
a - left border of the integration interval
b - right border of the integration interval
n - number of steps used for computation
real1DFunction - one-dimensional real-valued function to integrate numerically
Returns:
numerical approximation of the integral
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if n is not even

simpsonx

public static double simpsonx(double a,
                              double b,
                              Function real1DFunction,
                              double epsilon)
Computes the area under a real-valued function for a given interval [a,b] using the Simpson's rule for numerical integration iteratively until an error threshold is reached. For estimating the error, |S(n) - S (n/2)| <= epsilon * |S(n)| is used.

Parameters:
a - left border of the integration interval
b - right border of the integration interval
epsilon - error threshold used as |S(n) - S (n/2)| <= epsilon * |S(n)|
real1DFunction - real-valued (1D) function to integrate numerical
Returns:
numerical approximation of the integral for the given error bound

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
